content:

I due account sono collegati, ad esempio con filtri o funzioni di inoltro nelle impostazioni di Gmail? Gli account su Thunderbird sono POP3 o IMAP? Ci sono filtri in Thunderbird relativi a questi due account?

Senza una qualche modifica di configurazione o impostazione, quello descrivi non è tecnicamente possibile.

content: Ciao e grazie. Le mail che indirizzo a marcelloliberamente sono spediti da un giornale a cui sono abbonato e comunque la stessa cosa succede anche per gli articoli che spedisco (sempre a marcelloliberamente) genericamente in giro per siti internet Filtri o funzioni di inoltro non ce ne sono nelle impostazioni di Gmail come non ci sono filtri in Thunderbird relativi a questi 2 account. L'account principale (marciexglobal@gmail.com)su cui vengono duplicati i messaggi inviati a marcelloliberamente é POP3. L'altro è IMAP. Sono alla ricerca della modifica di configurazione o impostazione cha causa questo "sdoppiamento" dei messaggi, ma non riesco a trovarlo. Accetto ulteriori suggerimenti. Grazie e buona giornata.
creator: marciexglobal

content:
Threading was the same in 115. This link include steps to undo threads: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1439822 I do not recommend reverting to prior versions, as you will need to move to 128 in time and 128 is receiving regular updates. Also, reverting to prior release sometimes causes problems. One approach is to download prior release and install over the existing release, and then delete the compatibility.ini file in the profile. The officially recommended approach are these steps:

  1. Exit Thunderbird if running.
  2. click windows key and 'r' key
  3. Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade
  4. click on 'OK'
creator: davidsk

content:
Prova ad eseguire queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Those things fit easily on the right side of the card, below the breadcrumb icon and time, I don't need, or want them, to have an entire separate line. Is there any way to reformat the cards or not?

Two lines is great. Two lines gives plenty of space for the sender name and the subject line. An entire extra vertical line for two icons is a waste of screen space.

content: Mailmerge is an addon, not developed by the Thunderbird team. I suggest you contact the developer to report your issue. Thank you.

content:
First click the 'Get Certificate' button.

Then click the 'View' button in the exception prompt. This opens a Certificate Viewer window. Please post a screenshot of the Certificate Viewer window with the Issuer information visible. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/how-do-i-create-screenshot-my-problem

Also, what is your anti-virus software?
creator: christ1

Try to rebuild the index file of the troubled folder.

Right-click the folder - Properties - Repair Folder

content:
First, if any of the accounts are IMAP, do NOT log on the site, as if the messages there are gone, Thunderbird will promptly delete the messages on the PC. Here are suggested steps:

  1. there is text file named profiles.ini in the thunderbird folder. browse it and it will name the active profile's name
  2. that folder will be in the thunderbird\profiles folder
  3. imap accounts will be at imapmail\accountname and POP accounts at Mail\accountname and local folders at Mail\Local Folders. Message folders are generally in pairs of two, such as inbox and inbox.msf. The msf files are just indexes and Thunderbird will recreate them. (WARNING: depending on the status of your IMAP account, the message files may just contain headers. If so, the content is lost, but I am hopeful that the messages had fully downloaded.)
  4. your addressbook will be abook.sqlite and your collected addresses will be history.sqlite, both in the root folder of the profile.
  5. create a new Thunderbird profile and I recommend installing the importexporttools addon.
  6. for neatness in organizing your files and folders, I suggest this:
    • highlight Local Folders, rightclick and create a new subfolder for each account
    • for each account, highlight the folder with account name, rightclick, select the importexporttools option to import mbox
    • then, locate a saved message folder for the account and press enter key. Repeat for eachmessage folder for the account.
    • when done, you will have each account listed under Local Folders and within each, the related message folders
  7. for the addressbooks, you can click tools>import>import a file and proceed through menus to the sqlite option (another option is to just copy and paste them directly into the profile when thunderbird isn't running, overlaying the default files)
  1. once all that is done, you may want to reconstruct your files to their accounts. That can be done, but I'm tired of typing. Let me know how it goes.
creator: davidsk
